definition: not much to choose between the two/tweedledum and tweedledee
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
catty/(PRC) weight equal to 500 g/(Tw) weight equal to 600 g/(HK, Malaysia, Singapore) slightly over 604 g
eight/8
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)

sentences.english: Although he speaks English not very well, yours is not better.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他的英语说得不好，但是你也半斤八两。

sentences.english: Jimmy is trying to show Bill how to skate. The blind are leading the blind.
sentences.chinese: 吉米想教比尔怎么溜冰，他们俩其实是半斤八两。
“半斤八两，有啥区别，”我爸爸说。

sentences.english: But here comes the counter-revolution just the same.
sentences.chinese: 而由此招致的反革命也半斤八两。

definition: not to know one's place
lit. unable to distinguish eldest brother from second brother (idiom); they are all equally excellent/nothing to choose between them
to both share the limelight/to both have an equal share of
equally matched/about the same
to draw (a competition)/to fight to a standstill
(sports) draw/tie
almost on a par
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
the one who has retreated 50 steps laughs at the one who has retreated 100 steps (idiom)/the pot calls the kettle black
pinyin: wu3 shi2 bu4 xiao4 bai3 bu4

definition: no better (or worse) than each other/both in the same boat
well-matched/equally matched
evenly matched (idiom)
to beat comfortably/to win easily/abbr. for 穩操勝券|稳操胜券, to have victory within one's grasp
inferior/not up to par/to fall far short/to be mistaken
poles apart (idiom)/entirely different
not much difference
